SVG Mirror Polygon
This interactive polygon placement tool is an SVG image that edits itself. Click to place a polygon, and the next click will place a reflection of the polygon across one of its sides. The most recently placed polygon is selected, unless you shift-click to select another one. Shift-click the background to select none, and press backspace or delete to remove the selected polygon. Use control-C or command-C to copy a data URI containing the current image.
The following parameters listed with their default values can be edited using a query string:
borderColorCanvasText decimalPlaces12 fillColorred heightOfPolygon10 inlineStylecolor-scheme: light dark; background-color: Canvas selectedWidth.5 unselectedWidth.1 vertices5
Set the values using the first letter of the parameter name. The default values for the polygon border color and the background color are system colors. The vertices parameter can either be a number 3 or greater, or a 2D array of points defining any polygon. Convex polygons work best, and if you only specify the number of vertices then a regular polygon will be used.
For example, use these settings for a silver colored pentagon with one right angle: f=silver h=12 v=[[0,0],[0,1],[0.7401084675258551,1.3065629648763766],[1.3065629648763766,0.7401084675258551],[1,0]] . Here are two more examples: f=#000 h=14 v=[[1,0],[0.57919,0.57919],[0,1],[-0.57919,0.57919],[-1,0],[-0.57919,-0.57919],[0,-1],[0.57919,-0.57919]] , and i=background-image:url("https://www.nasa.gov/wp-content/uploads/static/history/alsj/a17/AS17-134-20387.jpg") .
